brief_summary.textblock:
To explore: (a) if physical exercise (sports) combined with cognitive training leads to
      (superior) improvement of cognition in schizophrenia compared to sports or cognitive
      training alone (b) if a sports program alone or in combination with cognitive training has
      influence on hippocampal pathology and synaptic plasticity in schizophrenia compared to a
      placebo condition.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhancing Synaptic Plasticity and Cognition in Schizophrenia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Male and female patients with the diagnosis of schizophrenia (based on ICD-10
             criteria)

          -  Age between 18 and 55

          -  Verbal IQ ≥ 85

          -  Stable psychopathology on constant medication for 2 weeks

          -  Informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Patients, who are

          -  not willing or able to participate in the sports program and cognitive training

          -  reveal a significant worsening of psychopathology (based on an increase over 20% of
             the PANSS positive score)

          -  have an organic mental disorder (such as intoxication or neurological disorders of
             the CNS)

          -  suffer from instable somatic diseases

          -  have an active substance abuse
